demesstify.visualize package

Submodules

demesstify.visualize.cloud module

Provides functionality for creating a WordCloud from a message conversation, as well as functionality for further analyzing of the messages.

class demesstify.visualize.cloud.Cloud(messages: Optional[str] = None)

Bases: WordCloud

Wrapper for the WordCloud object with added functionality.

Can also store and analyze messages.

Properties:
words:

Easy access to an object that provides message-analyzing functionality.

mask:

The custom mask that is used when generating the WordCloud.

add_stopwords(stopwords: Union[str, list[str]])

Adds one or more words to the default set of stopwords.

feed_messages(messages: str)

Analyzes and stores the given messages as a class variable.

generate()

Generates the WordCloud and updates the Words instance.

property mask: ndarray

Returns the mask.

save(path: str)

Wrapper around WordCloud’s to_file method.

property words: Words

Return the words instance.

class demesstify.visualize.cloud.Words(cloud: Optional[Cloud] = None)

Bases: object

Helper class that provides access to word-related functions.

get_counts(*args, **kwargs) → Any
get_most_frequent(*args, **kwargs) → Any
is_valid() → bool

Determines if it is viable to perform certain methods that require the WordCloud to be generated.

Essentially checks if a Cloud object has been fed to the instance of Words.

update(cloud: Cloud)

Updates the cloud reference as well as other variables.

demesstify.visualize.cloud.requires_cloud(method: Callable) → Callable

Decorator that determines whether or not it is okay to run a method that typically requires first generating the WordCloud.

demesstify.visualize.color_funcs module

Provides functions related to colors.

demesstify.visualize.color_funcs.constant_hue(hue)

Returns a function that itself returns an HSL value for a color with a constant hue but with some variation in lightness.

demesstify.visualize.color_funcs.random_color(word=None, font_size=None, position=None, orientation=None, font_path=None, random_state=None)

Returns an HSL value for a completely random color.

demesstify.visualize.color_funcs.random_gray(word, font_size, position, orientation, random_state=None, **kwargs)

Randomly generates a gray HSL color value.

demesstify.visualize.plots module

Provides functionality for visualizing messages.

class demesstify.visualize.plots.StackedFrequencyBarChart(data: list[tuple[demesstify.analysis.emojis.Emoji, int, int, int]], figsize: tuple[int, int] = (7, 7))

Bases: FrequencyBarChart

class demesstify.visualize.plots.WeekdayRadialHeatmap(data: DataFrame)

Bases: object

Class to create a radial heatmap of text message frequency.

The radial heatmap has 24 slices (1 for each hour of the day) and 7 layers (1 for each day of the week). Each cell of the heatmap is then colored according to the specified colormap, with color intensity determined by the frequency of text messages during that day and time.

generate(figsize: tuple[int, int] = (7, 7), cmap: Union[str, Colormap] = 'viridis', outline_color: str = 'black', grid_color: str = 'black', weekday_color: str = 'black', hour_color: str = 'black', font_name: str = 'Helvetica', font_size: float = 10, donut_hole: bool = True, donut_radius: float = 0.5, show_weekdays: bool = True, show_hours: bool = True, show_outline: bool = True, show_grid: bool = True, cbar: bool = False, cbar_location: Optional[str] = 'vertical', cbar_shrink: float = 1.0, cbar_padding: Optional[float] = None, cbar_aspect: float = 20, cbar_label: Optional[str] = None, cbar_text_color: str = 'black', cbar_tick_color: str = 'black', cbar_outline_color: str = 'black', cbar_outline_linewidth: float = 1, cbar_title: Optional[str] = None, cbar_minorticks: bool = False)

Generates the radial heatmap.
